description: The ultimate vegetable soup is a meal in itself, packed full with healthy veggies, spices and aromatics. This meal, if served as four portions, provides 110kcal, 3g protein, 13g carbohydrate (of which 5g sugars), 14g fat (of which 0.6g saturates), 4g fibre and 1g salt per portion.

For the aromatics: and/or 1-2 fresh red chillies, de-seeded and chopped
or 1 tsp or more curry paste or curry powder or spices, e.g. cumin, fennel seeds, cinnamon, etc
For the base ingredients: 2 tbsp olive or sunflower oil, or 30g/1oz butter
For the liquid: 1-1.5 litres/1¾-2¾ pints) vegetable or chicken stock, or vegetable cooking water, or a mixture of water and milk
For the main ingredients: 1 potato, or other thickener if needed, peeled and cut into chunks
500g/18oz vegetables, prepared as appropriate and roughly chopped

steps: Heat the oil or butter gently in a large saucepan, then add the base ingredients, the aromatics and the main ingredients. Stir around to coat everything in the fat, then sweat very gently for 10-15 minutes.

Add 1litre/1¾pints of stock or other liquid, saving the rest for thinning down (if necessary), and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Bring up to the boil, then simmer gently for about 20 minutes until all the vegetables are tender.
Liquidise in several batches, and return to the pan. Thin down with the reserved stock, water or milk as required, and check the seasoning
title: Good vegetable soup
